big_picture_notes: 1 Timothy is a pastoral letter structured by two major charges to Timothy, framed by greeting and benediction. It blends hortatory imperatives with didactic instruction to combat false teaching and to establish godly order in the church. Literary glue includes the contrast between sound teaching and myths/genealogies, the ‘mystery of godliness’ (3:16) as theological center, and an inclusio of charge→exposition→practice that returns to a climactic final charge. The flow moves from personal commission (ch. 1) to corporate worship and leadership (chs. 2–3), then to practical godliness against error (chs. 4–5), culminating in warnings about wealth and a solemn oath‑charge (ch. 6).

stories.story_title: Initial Charge: The Purpose of the Law and Warning Against False Teaching
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:3) ‘remain at Ephesus… charge certain persons’ sets the narrative/imperative purpose; end (1:20) names Hymenaeus and Alexander, concretizing the warning. Glue: law/teaching vocabulary (nomos/didaskalia) and a doxology (1:17) that underwrites the charge’s authority.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Apostolic greeting flows into the first directive to stop different doctrine. Devices: commission verb ‘charge’ (paraggellō), conflict markers (myths, genealogies).

scenes.scene_name: The Goal of the Charge vs Vain Discussion
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Aim is love from pure heart, good conscience, sincere faith; ends with would‑be law‑teachers lacking understanding. Devices: antithesis (love vs vain talk), purpose definition.

scenes.scene_name: The Proper Use of the Law
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Law is good if used lawfully; vice list shows its target; closes with ‘glorious gospel’ trust. Devices: enumerated parallelism, law/gospel linkage.
Thanksgiving for strength and mercy; ‘chief of sinners’; sealed by doxology. Devices: autobiographical ethos, climactic doxology (1:17).

scenes.scene_name: Reiteration of the Charge and Consequence
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: ‘This charge I entrust…’ wage the good warfare; names delivered to Satan. Devices: warfare metaphor, exempla of discipline, inclusio with 1:3.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (2:1) ‘First of all, then…’ marks the shift to assembly life; end (3:16) confessional hymn on the mystery of godliness crowns the order instructions. Glue: order/propriety (kosmios) and godliness (eusebeia) recur; leadership qualifications anchor corporate structure.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Urging prayers; one God/one mediator; Paul commissioned to Gentiles. Devices: enumerated prayers, mediator motif, apostolic testimony.

scenes.scene_name: Men and Women in Corporate Prayer
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Men pray with holy hands; women with modesty/quietness; Adam/Eve rationale; preservation statement. Devices: juxtaposition, typological proof, propriety theme.
‘Trustworthy saying’: oversight as noble task; character checklist; good reputation with outsiders. Devices: enumerated traits, blamelessness envelope, home/public symmetry.
‘Deacons likewise…’ tested first; reward of good standing; women/wives directive (3:11). Devices: examination process, parallel attributes, translational ambiguity noted.

scenes.scene_name: The Mystery of Godliness (Why Order Matters)
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Purpose of writing: conduct in God’s household; church as pillar/buttress; hymn on the mystery of godliness. Devices: architectural metaphor, creedal six‑line confession.

stories.story_title: Instructions for Godly Living and Confronting Error
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (4:1) Spirit’s explicit oracle marks new unit on error and godliness; end (5:25) moral maxim on conspicuous works closes the household/office guidance before slave instructions. Glue: godless myths vs training for godliness; imperative cadence (‘command/teach’).

scenes.scene_name: Source and Error of Future Apostasy
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Spirit says: some depart; forbidding marriage/foods countered by creation’s goodness. Devices: prophetic oracle, enumeration, consecration rationale.
Set these things before brothers; train for godliness; be an example; devote/read/teach; progress visible. Devices: antithesis myths vs godliness, imperative chain, model metaphor.
Do not rebuke older man; appeal as father/brother/mother/sister with purity. Devices: family metaphor, paired parallelism.
Honor true widows; family duty emphasized; failure worse than unbelief. Devices: casuistic instruction, severe censure for neglect.

scenes.scene_name: Care of Widows II: Roll and Conduct
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Enrollment criteria; younger widows counselled to marry/manage homes; church relieved. Devices: eligibility list, remedy for idleness/gossip.

Double honor; do not admit charge without witnesses; rebuke in presence of all; impartiality; keep yourself pure; note on wine; visible sins/works. Devices: judicial process, impartial charge, concluding maxim.

stories.story_title: Final Admonitions, Danger of Wealth, and Closing Charge
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (6:1) slave/master instruction opens final cluster; end (6:21) ‘Grace be with you’ closes letter. Glue: godliness vs love of money, ‘sound words’ vs controversy, and a solemn oath‑charge (6:11–16) forming inclusio with the opening charge.

scenes.scene_name: Slaves, False Teachers, and the Love of Money
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Honor masters so God’s name isn’t reviled; false teachers linked to greed; contentment maxim; love of money root of evils. Devices: social instruction→censure→maxim, cause–effect chain, piercing metaphor.
Flee/pursue; fight the good fight; keep the command unstained until appearing; doxological depiction of God. Devices: covenantal charge, parallel imperatives, oath by confession, mini‑doxology.
Charge the rich: not haughty, hope in God, be rich in good works; lay up a firm foundation. Devices: contrast trust, financial metaphor for treasure.
Guard the deposit; avoid profane chatter/contradictions; grace be with you. Devices: deposit metaphor (parathēkē), inclusio with opening charge, benediction formula.
